Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*Entry to Samoa: Samoa’s international borders are open to all from 1 August 2022. Travellers aged 12 years and above, including crew, are required to be fully vaccinated before entry into Samoa with any vaccine pre-qualified by WHO. For further details, see the Ministry of health website. Demonstrating your COVID-19 status: A legitimate vaccine certificate is required for boarding and a hard copy must be presented at check-in and upon arrival into Samoa. Electronic vaccine certificates will not be accepted.
A negative RT-PCR is required, taken within 48 hours of departure from originating airport, or a supervised Negative Rapid Antigen Test (RAT), taken within 24 hours of departure from originating airport. This applies to all passengers, including children and infants.
Upon arrival into Samoa:
• passengers must submit to a Nasal pharyngeal swab at the airport
• passengers must undergo a supervised RAT within 3 days of arrival, and
• if positive, self-isolate at home for 7 days then undergo a further RAT test
Full details can be found on the Ministry of health website.

Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Samoa: Public transport, including bus and ferry services, is available in Samoa.
*Public places and services: Government and public life has returned to normal with the removal of Alert Levels and restrictions.
